name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 4-decylphenyl and methylbenzamide functionalities contribute to the melting point: The decylphenyl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at +20 °C. The methylbenzamide moiety introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, raising the melting point by approximately +30 °C. The presence of two additional phenyl groups contributes to an increase in molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, with an approximate increase of +40 °C per group, totaling +80 °C.
